text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

If the rain hadn't fallen, we wouldn't have missed the match?

options.A: The rain is falling, so we will miss the match
options.B: The rain fell, so we didn't watch the match
options.C: The rain didn't fall, so we didn't watch the match
options.D: The rain didn't fall, so we didn't miss the match

explanation:
The sentence is using a conditional statement in the past perfect tense to express a hypothetical situation and its result. "If the rain hadn't fallen" implies that the rain did fall, and as a result, "we wouldn't have missed the match." This means that because the rain fell, they did not watch the match. Therefore, option B correctly explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

The class was tired of the new boy jawing away all the time?

options.B: He was always chewing in the class
options.C: He was always making trouble for the class
options.D: He talked continuously in the class

explanation:
A. He bit off people's jaws:  This option is not the answer because it takes the expression "jawing away" too literally. In this context, "jawing away" is an informal phrase that means talking or chatting continuously, not physically biting off people's jaws.
B. He was always chewing in the class: This option is incorrect because it misinterprets the meaning of "jawing away." The phrase refers to talking or chatting, not chewing.
C. He was always making trouble for the class: This option is not the answer because while "jawing away" might imply being talkative, it doesn't necessarily mean causing trouble. It's more about continuous talking or chatter.
D. He talked continuously in the class.- This option is correct because it accurately captures the meaning of "jawing away" in this context. The sentence indicates that the new boy talked a lot in class, causing the class to become tired of it. So, option D is the best explanation for the information conveyed in the sentence.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

The new Headmaster hoped that his men would pull together?

options.A: He expected that the men would cooperate with him
options.B: He thought that the men would compose themselves at work
options.C: He was certain that they would resign en masse
options.D: He was certain that their condition would improve under him

explanation:
A. He expected that the men would cooperate with him: This option is the best explanation because "pull together" is a common idiom that means to work together in cooperation and harmony. The sentence suggests that the new Headmaster hoped for unity and collaboration among his team.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

If the trader paid in full, his order was not pruned down.

options.A: The trader who made full payment did not have his order reduced
options.B: The trader who made some payment did not have his order delayed
options.C: Unless the trader paid  in full his order would be rejected
options.D: As the trader did not increase his order, he did not need to pay in full

explanation:
The sentence implies that when the trader paid in full, his order was not reduced or pruned down. This suggests that full payment ensured the fulfilment of the trader's order without any reduction in quantity or size.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

The men were not pawns in someone else's political game?

options.A: The action they executed was their idea
options.B: The men used someone else's plan
options.C: They were used by someone's political game

explanation:
The sentence suggests that the men were not acting on their own initiative but were being manipulated or controlled by someone else's political agenda. They were not independent actors but rather tools or pawns in a larger political scheme orchestrated by others.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

The crisis ended as suddenly as it began?

options.B: The crisis will not end suddenly

explanation:
The sentence "The crisis ended as suddenly as it began" implies that the crisis came to a halt in a very short period of time, just like how it started abruptly.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

One thing I will not be complaining about in my new job is a lack of excitement?

options.C: The job is not too  exciting
options.D: The job has been previously done

explanation:
The sentence expresses that the speaker will not be complaining about a lack of excitement in their new job. This indicates that the job is indeed exciting or interesting to them. Therefore, option B is the most appropriate explanation.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

The Governor parried all the questions put to him by the journalist?

options.A: The governor answered all the questions  brilliantly
options.B: The Governor evaded all the questions
options.C: The Governor failed all the questions
options.D: The  Governor mastered all the questions

explanation:
The term "parried" in this context means that the Governor skillfully avoided or dodged all the questions posed by the journalist, indicating evasion rather than direct answering. Therefore, option B provides the most accurate explanation.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

If I visited England, I might go to Manchester City.

options.A: When I go to England , I could go to Manchester City
options.B: Whenever I visit England, I must go to Manchester City
options.C: I did not go to England and could  not go to Manchester
options.D: I could not visit Manchester City because I did not want to go to England

explanation:
The sentence implies that if the speaker visits England in the future, there is a possibility (but not a certainty) that they will go to Manchester City. Option A accurately captures this conditional statement.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

The man puts his foot down whenever he is convinced of his action?

options.A: He desires to assert his will in the situation
options.B: He makes his mark whereever he goes
options.C: His attitude demonstrates someone who likes to oppress others around him

explanation:
The sentence suggests that the man shows determination and decisiveness ("puts his foot down") when he believes in his actions or decisions. This indicates a firmness of character rather than a desire to assert dominance, make an impact everywhere, or oppress others. Option D aligns most closely with the idea of demonstrating firmness in one's convictions.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The teacher recounted two events that were analogous with each other.
explanation:
"Analogous" means similar or comparable, so "different from" provides the opposite meaning in this context.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The principal was filled with scorn when we gave our reason for coming late.
explanation:
The opposite of "scorn" is "sympathy." "Scorn" refers to a feeling of contempt or disdain, while "sympathy" refers to understanding and compassion.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

After fifty years, he could not find anyone who was contemporary with him at college.
explanation:
The word "contemporary" in this context refers to someone who was in the same time period or era, especially with regard to education. Therefore, the opposite of "contemporary" would be someone who is "strange to" or not associated with that time period. Hence, the correct option is: A. strange to
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

Idris gives me a sour look every time I pass by him.
explanation:
The word "sour" in this context suggests a negative or unfriendly expression. Therefore, the opposite of "sour" would be something positive or friendly.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The officer was given an invidious task?
explanation:
The word "invidious" in this context means "likely to arouse resentment or anger in others." Therefore, the opposite of "invidious" would be more agreeable or favourable.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The views of the plateau are in stark contrast to the workaday cottages below.
explanation:
workadaymeans ''not special, unusual, or uninteresting; ordinary''.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The president can afford to dispense with some of his henchmen.
explanation:
"henchmen" in this context refers to loyal supporters or followers, often with a negative connotation that implies blind obedience or unquestioning loyalty. Therefore, the opposite of "henchmen" would be someone who opposes or criticises the president. "Detractors" are individuals who criticise or speak against someone or something.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word or phrase.

The judge did not grant the request that the witness should appear by proxy.
explanation:
The underlined phrase "appear by proxy" means to be represented by someone else, typically a legal representative or proxy. Therefore, the opposite of "appear by proxy" would be to be present in person. This means that the witness would physically attend or be present at the specified location, rather than being represented by a proxy.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

It would be difficult to defeat such a highly motivated team.
explanation:
demoralized means to Cause (someone) to lose confidence or hope.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

Asabe bought a glossy pair of shoes.
explanation:
The underlined word "glossy" in this context refers to something that is smooth, shiny and polished. Therefore, the opposite of "glossy" would be something that is rough and dull.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

Manu is hard to convince because he is an opinionated person?
explanation:
The underlined word "opinionated" in this context refers to someone who is stubbornly holding onto their own opinions and is not easily swayed or convinced by others. Therefore, the opposite of "opinionated" would be someone who is more open-minded and willing to consider different perspectives. "Objective" refers to being impartial, fair, and open to considering different viewpoints, which contrasts with the stubbornness or closed-mindedness associated with being "opinionated."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

Some people consider the leather upholstery and thick rugs a bit sumptuous.
explanation:
"Sumptuous" in this context refers to something luxurious, extravagant or opulent. Therefore, the opposite of "sumptuous" would be something that is modest, plain, or simple.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The dramatist provided a satisfactory denouement to the play?
explanation:
"Denouement" refers to the resolution or conclusion of a play, novel or story. Therefore, the opposite of "denouement" would be "introduction". "Introduction" refers to the beginning or initial part of a play or story.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

Many Nigerian are wary of night journeys
explanation:
If you are wary of something, you are cautious because you do not know much about them and you believe they may be dangerous or cause problems.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The proprietor accused Uche of silently acquiescing to the students' demands?
explanation:
"Acquiescing" in this context means to passively accept or agree to something without protest or resistance. Therefore, the opposite of "acquiescing" would be to actively resist or oppose something. "Resisting" means to oppose or stand against something, which is the opposite of silently accepting or acquiescing to it.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The greatness of the creator of the universe is always inexpressible to many adherents of certain faiths?
explanation:
The option nearest in meaning to the underlined word "inexpressible" is:
D. ineffable
Both "inexpressible" and "ineffable" refer to something that is beyond description or unable to be expressed adequately in words. They convey a sense of awe or wonder that cannot be fully captured by language.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).

We made a pie in the business deal.
explanation:
To "make a pie" means to earn or make a profit. Therefore, the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word "made a pie" is:
B. earned a lot of money
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

Yesterday, my mother asked me......
explanation:
The sentence should read: "Yesterday, my mother asked me if I was tired?" This structure is grammatically correct for forming reported statement.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

The Bank Manager assured us that there was nothing to worry about ...... ?
explanation:
The sentence should read: "The Bank Manager assured us that there was nothing to worry about with regard to the loan." This choice uses the correct prepositional phrase "with regard to" to indicate the specific aspect ("the loan") that there is nothing to worry about. Options A, C, and D are not grammatically correct or commonly used in standard English.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

The first prize was ....... tray?
explanation:
The sentence should read: "The first prize was an attractive, carved wooden tray."
This option follows the correct order of adjectives in English. In this case, "attractive" is an opinion, "carved" describes the physical quality and "wooden" describes the material.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

Tsadu always cautions that difficult jobs should be done .......?
explanation:
The sentence should read: "Tsadu always cautions that difficult jobs should be done step by step." This phrase means that difficult tasks should be approached gradually, one step at a time, rather than trying to tackle everything at once. "Step by step" is the standard way to express this idea.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

I was often angry ....... Oche since he differed ....... me often?
explanation:
The phrase "angry with" is the correct usage. This phrase is used to indicate the emotion of anger directed towards a specific person or entity. In this case, the speaker is expressing anger towards Oche specifically because of their differing opinions. On the other hand, "angry about" could also be used in certain contexts, such as "I was angry about his behaviour," where the anger is directed towards a situation or event rather than a specific person.
The phrase "differed with" is the correct usage to indicate that you have contrasting opinions with someone else. "With". "differed from" is used to indicate the difference between objects and ideas and does now show that someone has differing opinions from someone else.
Therefore, option D, "with / with," is the correct choice.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

I am writing to you for ....... reasons?
explanation:
This option provides a clear and concise completion to the sentence and indicates that there are multiple reasons for writing the letter.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

As we sat ....... the silence, my eyes ....... the room?
explanation:
In this sentence, the preposition "in" is used to indicate the location where the action is taking place. "Roamed" is the appropriate verb choice here because it suggests that the eyes were moving around or wandering casually, which fits the context of sitting quietly and looking around the room without a specific focus.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

Is it true that Okoro ........ when the gates were closed?
explanation:
"Had returned" is in the past perfect tense, which is used to indicate an action that was completed before another past action or time in the past.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

The public library has stopped ........ books to readers?
explanation:
"Lending" refers to the action of giving something to someone temporarily, with the expectation of it being returned. In the context of a library, lending books to readers is a common practice where readers can borrow books for a certain period.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

We won't leave until it ........ raining?
explanation:
The verb "stops" is in the present simple tense. In this context, it indicates an action that is expected to happen in the future but is expressed with a present-tense verb. "Until it stops raining" implies that the action of stopping (the rain) will occur at some point in the future.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

The ...... event marked the beginning of a new life for the entire cabinet?
explanation: There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

The train ...... before I arrived?
explanation:
"Had left" is in the past perfect tense, which is used to indicate an action that occurred before another action in the past. In this context, the train's departure (leaving) happened before the speaker's arrival, so the past perfect tense "had left" is appropriate.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

You can travel on your own ....?
explanation:
The phrase "can't you" is used here as a tag question to seek confirmation or agreement from the listener. To create a question tag, you have to add the exact verb but in a negative form.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

The man is refurbishing the flat with a view to ......it?
explanation:
"With a view to" is a phrase that indicates the purpose or intention behind an action. In this context, the purpose of refurbishing the flat is to sell it in the future. The gerund form "selling" is used after "with a view to" to indicate the intended action (selling the flat) that will result from the refurbishment.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

The Secretary-General was shocked at the number of...... ?
explanation:
"Child soldiers" refers to individuals who are under the age of 18 and are recruited or used by armed forces or armed groups in conflicts as combatants, cooks, porters, spies, or for other purposes.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

In spite of Shade's good looks, her hair is always ...... ?
explanation:
unkempt:(especially of a person) having an untidy or dishevelled appearance.
example "they were unwashed and unkempt"
synonyms:untidy · messy · scruffy · disordered · dishevelled · disarranged · rumpled · windblown · ungroomed · bedraggled · in a mess · messed up · shabby · slovenly · shaggy
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

By the end of the football match today, we ...... the best player?
explanation:
Will,would, andhaveare auxiliary verbs used to form different tenses.Will haveis used to form Future Perfect, to describe something that not simply takes place in the future, but is completed ("perfected") at some reference point in the future (which is usually specified).
Example; I will have done that by the end of the week.⇒ I will do that, and at the reference point (end of the week), my action will be over; I will be able to say "I have done it".
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

It is African for a younger person to show ...... to elders?
explanation:
"Deference" refers to a respectful attitude or behaviour towards someone considered superior or deserving of respect, such as elders, authority figures, or experts. In many African cultures, showing deference or respect to elders is a common and highly valued practice that reflects cultural norms and values related to respect for age, wisdom, and experience.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

A nursery rhyme is used to teach pupils how to spell the word ...... ?
explanation:
Hippopotamus
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(S).

You, who ...... convicted, should appeal.
explanation:
The phrase "has been convicted" is in the present perfect tense. The present perfect tense is used to describe actions that happened at an unspecified time in the past or actions that started in the past and continued into the present. In this sentence, it implies that the person being addressed has recently been convicted, and this conviction is relevant to the present moment. The other options do not fit grammatically or contextually: - "is convicted" would be used for something ongoing in the present, not necessarily recent. - "Was convicted" is in the past tense, which doesn't convey the recentness or ongoing relevance of the conviction. - "Are convicted" is incorrect because "are" is not the correct verb form to use with "convicted" in this context.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

beer
explanation:
beer - /bɪə/
bear - /beə/

Choose the option that has the same consonant sound as the one represented by the letters underlined.

Healthy?
explanation:
The underlined  ''thy'' sound is pronounced with the tip of the tongue in between the teeth as;
healthy; /ˈhɛlθi/
path; /pɑːθ/
Healthy and path have the ''θ'' sound when pronounced.

ink - /ɪŋk/

jurisprudence?

/ˌdʒʊə.rɪsˈpruː.dəns/

suburbanite

departmentalize?

/ˌdi.pɑːtˈmen.təl.aɪz/

Choose the option that has the same stress pattern as the given word.

Refuse (noun)
explanation:
Refuse (noun) - /ˈref.juːs/

text:
Choose the option that has the same stress pattern as the given word.

downtrodden?
explanation:
downGRAding
preSCRIbing
FUNCtional
inTERnal
Downtrodden has its stress on the first syllable. However, Option A (Downgrading) can also have its stress on the first syllable according to the Oxford Dictionary making Option C the safest option.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Choose the option that has a different stress pattern from the others.
explanation:
interpreter - /ɪnˈtɜː.prə.tə/
impossible - /ɪmˈpɒs.ə.bəl/
remarkable - /rɪˈmɑː.kə.bəl/

text: Choose the option that has a different stress pattern from the others.
explanation:
stressed syllables are the syllables within a word that have the most emphasis when spoken.for example:other- the syllable"oth" is stressed and the syllable"er"is not because"er"is pronounced less that"oth"the"er"tends to sound as if it were falling away at the end of the word.compound words;tend to be double stressed because both syllables are pronounced equallyfor examplechildhood- both "child" and "hood" are pronounced fullyyou can tell which syllable is stressed by saying the word naturallyIn words of two syllables or more, at least one of the syllables is usually pronounced with extra emphasis. We can divide syllables into stressed and unstressed categories.
impound; (words with prefix are usually stressed on the second syllable) this would be stressed as imPOUND
subject(verb);as a verb is stressed thus subJECT
canoe;is stressed on the second syllable as caNOE
knowledge;is a compound word made up of two different words ''know and ledge''. it is therefore stressed on the first syllable as KNOWledge
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The word in capital letters has the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates.

Your mother CAN cook the meal.

options.B: Can my father cook the meal?
options.C: Isn't my mother able to cook the meal?

explanation:
Emphatic stress is the placement of greater stress on a particular word or phrase in an utterance for the sake of emphasis or clarification. For questions on emphatic stress, the goal is to look for the question that contradicts the stressed word or phrase in the utterance. The utterance, in this context, is trying to clarify that the mother "can" actually cook the meal. So, it should be the response to the question "Isn't your mother able to cook the meal?"
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The word in capital letters has the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates.

The EAGLES won the match.

options.A: Did the Eagles lose the match?
options.D: Did the Eagles win the match?

explanation:
Emphatic stress is the placement of greater stress on a particular word or phrase in an utterance for the sake of emphasis or clarification. For questions on emphatic stress, the goal is to look for the question that contradicts the stressed word or phrase in the utterance. "Eagles" is stressed in the utterance because it is the answer to the question: "Who won the Eagles?"
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
